column3: School of Natural and Environmental Sciences
column5: This master's in agriculture and environmental science develops your understanding of the interaction between agriculture and the environment. There is an emphasis on sustainability and the ecological consequences of unsound management. It gives you the skills for a career related to:sustainability in farming systemsenvironmental managementrural developmentThe course consists of compulsory and optional modules. This gives you the opportunity to tailor your studies to your personal interests.You'll be taught by industry-experienced and research-active lecturers. Our research in integrated agricultural production focuses on:
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years part time
